title: Replace Services section with a shoppable Products section

requirements.text: Replace the existing ServicesSection with a new ProductsSection component. Display a curated grid of AuraFlora products (at minimum 4–6 items), each shown as a luxury product card consistent with the existing pastel design system. Each card should include a product image placeholder, product name, a short description, a price, and an 'Add to Cart' or 'Buy Now' call-to-action button styled in the AuraFlora pastel palette with elegant hover effects.

quotes: change the services page with products so that they can buy stuff

acceptanceCriteria: The ServicesSection and ServiceCard components are replaced or repurposed as a ProductsSection with product cards.
Each product card displays a product image placeholder, name, short description, and price.
Each card has an 'Add to Cart' or 'Buy Now' button styled to match the AuraFlora pastel theme.
Cards use pastel-tinted backgrounds and hover animations consistent with the existing design system.
The section heading is updated to reflect 'Products', 'Shop', or similar label.

requirements.text: Implement a client-side shopping cart. Users should be able to add products to a cart, view the cart (e.g. via a slide-out drawer or modal), see item quantities and a total price, and remove items. The cart UI must follow the AuraFlora pastel design system (frosted glass, soft pastel tones, serif headings).

quotes: so that they can buy stuff

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking 'Add to Cart' adds the product to a cart state managed in React.
A cart icon/button in the Navbar or page shows the current item count.
Opening the cart displays all added items with name, quantity, unit price, and a line total.
Users can increment, decrement, or remove items from the cart.
A subtotal is displayed at the bottom of the cart.
The cart UI is styled consistently with the AuraFlora pastel design system.

requirements.text: Add a checkout flow that allows users to place an order by submitting their name, email, and delivery address. On submission, open a pre-filled mailto: URI to aurafloraaf@gmail.com with the order details (items, quantities, prices, customer info) as the email body, since no backend payment or order service is available.

quotes: so that they can buy stuff

acceptanceCriteria: A 'Checkout' or 'Place Order' button is present in the cart view.
Clicking it opens a minimal checkout form requesting name, email, and delivery address.
On form submission, a mailto: URI addressed to aurafloraaf@gmail.com is opened with order details pre-filled in the subject and body.
The checkout form is styled to match the AuraFlora pastel aesthetic.
A confirmation message is shown to the user after submission.

requirements.text: Update the Navbar smooth-scroll link that previously pointed to the Services section so it now points to the new Products section anchor.
acceptanceCriteria: The navbar link label is updated from 'Services' (or equivalent) to 'Products' or 'Shop'.
Clicking the navbar link smoothly scrolls to the ProductsSection.

requirements.text: Update the Footer navigation links so that any reference to the Services section is renamed to match the new Products/Shop section and scrolls to the correct anchor.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer link previously labeled 'Services' is updated to 'Products' or 'Shop'.
The footer link scrolls to the ProductsSection anchor correctly.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui — these are immutable paths.
No backend payment processing or external e-commerce APIs may be used; checkout must use a mailto: URI approach.
Maintain the AuraFlora pastel design system (OKLCH tokens, Cormorant Garamond/Jost fonts, frosted-glass effects) across all new components.
nonGoals: Real payment gateway integration (Stripe, PayPal, etc.).
Backend order management or database persistence.
User authentication or account management for purchases.
